At a certain school, students either walk to class or ride to class on a bicycle, skateboard, or other device. The transition matrix shown gives the probabilities that indicate how a student will get to class on the next day by how they got to class on a given day. The <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for walk and <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> for ride above the matrix represent the given day, and the <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> and <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> left of the matrix represent the next day. On day <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> of a certain week, <math alttext="120"><mn>120</mn></math> students walked and <math alttext="65"><mn>65</mn></math> students rode. Approximately how many students rode to class on day <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> ?
